title: Hosea Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Hosea chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Hosea Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Hosea Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to Hosea 3:1, whom did the LORD tell Hosea to love?
options: A woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress
A woman from the tribe of Israel
A prophetess who foretold the future
questions.correctAnswer: A woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1 states that the LORD told Hosea to love a woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress.

questions.question: In Hosea 3:2, what did Hosea give to buy the woman?
options: Fifteen pieces of silver, an homer of barley, and a half homer of barley
Ten pieces of gold and a lamb
Seven pieces of silver and a basket of fruit
questions.correctAnswer: Fifteen pieces of silver, an homer of barley, and a half homer of barley
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:2 says Hosea bought the woman for fifteen pieces of silver and barley in specified amounts.

questions.question: What instruction did Hosea give to the woman according to Hosea 3:3?
options: She shall abide for many days and not play the harlot
She shall leave the city and never return
She shall marry another man immediately
She shall go to the temple and offer sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: She shall abide for many days and not play the harlot
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:3 records Hosea telling the woman to abide many days and not be for another man or play the harlot.

questions.question: According to Hosea 3:4, what will the children of Israel be without for many days?
options: A king, a prince, a sacrifice, an image, an ephod, and teraphim
questions.correctAnswer: A king, a prince, a sacrifice, an image, an ephod, and teraphim
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 states the children of Israel will be without those listed for many days.

questions.question: What will the children of Israel do afterward according to Hosea 3:5?
options: Return and seek the LORD their God and David their king
Build many altars to other gods
Forget the LORD and follow idols
questions.correctAnswer: Return and seek the LORD their God and David their king
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 says that afterward the children of Israel will return and seek the LORD and David their king.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea was told to love a woman who was faithful and had not been with another man.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1 describes the woman as beloved of her friend but an adulteress, meaning she was not faithful.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea purchased the woman for ten pieces of silver and an homer of wheat.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:2 states the price was fifteen pieces of silver, an homer of barley, and a half homer of barley, not ten silver or wheat.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 3:5 mentions that the children of Israel will fear the LORD and His goodness in the latter days.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 clearly states they shall fear the LORD and his goodness in the latter days.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Hosea 3:3: 'Thou shalt abide for me many days; thou shalt not play the ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: harlot
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:3 instructs the woman not to play the harlot during the days she abides with Hosea.

questions.question: According to Hosea 3:1, the love of the LORD toward whom is compared to Hosea's love for the woman?
questions.correctAnswer: The children of Israel
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1 compares Hosea's love for the woman to the LORD's love toward the children of Israel.

questions.question: What were the children of Israel loving besides other gods according to Hosea 3:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Flagons of wine
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1 says the children of Israel love flagons of wine along with looking to other gods.

questions.question: Which items are listed as being absent among the children of Israel in Hosea 3:4?
options: King, prince, sacrifice, image, ephod, and teraphim
questions.correctAnswer: King, prince, sacrifice, image, ephod, and teraphim
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 lists these specific things as absent from Israel for many days.

questions.question: In Hosea 3:2, what grain is mentioned that Hosea gave as part of the purchase price?
questions.correctAnswer: Barley
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:2 states an homer of barley and a half homer of barley were part of the price.

questions.question: According to Hosea 3:5, whom will the children of Israel seek besides the LORD their God?
questions.correctAnswer: David their king
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 mentions that Israel will seek David their king after returning to the LORD.

questions.question: According to Hosea 3:3, how will Hosea be for the woman?
options: He will also be for her
questions.correctAnswer: He will also be for her
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:3 says Hosea will be for her as she is not to be for another man or play the harlot.

medium.title: Hosea Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Hosea Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Hosea 3 teach us about forgiveness and reconciliation in marriage?
options: By showing God’s love for a wayward woman and calling for faithfulness
By instructing to immediately end relationships with unfaithful partners
By suggesting ignoring unfaithfulness without addressing it
questions.correctAnswer: By showing God’s love for a wayward woman and calling for faithfulness
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1-3 shows God commanding Hosea to love a woman who was an adulteress, symbolizing God's forgiving love toward Israel despite their unfaithfulness. This teaches the value of forgiveness and restoration in marriage relationships.

questions.question: What does Hosea 3:2 teach about the value of redemption and restoration?
options: Redemption requires a price and intentional commitment
Forgiveness should be delayed until full punishment
questions.correctAnswer: Redemption requires a price and intentional commitment
questions.explanation: In Hosea 3:2, Hosea buys the woman for fifteen pieces of silver and barley, indicating that restoration requires a deliberate and costly act, reflecting God’s redeeming love for His people.

questions.question: Based on Hosea 3:3, what biblical principle about faithfulness is taught that can apply to personal devotion?
options: Faithfulness requires a commitment to abstain from unfaithfulness
Faithfulness is irrelevant to spiritual growth
Faithfulness should only be shown when others are faithful
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness requires a commitment to abstain from unfaithfulness
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:3 commands the woman not to play the harlot and to remain faithful, teaching believers to commit themselves to spiritual faithfulness and avoid sin for a healthy relationship with God.

questions.question: A believer struggles with trusting God during times of leadership absence. What truth from Hosea 3:4 can you share?
options: There may be times without earthly leaders, but God’s love and plan remain
Without leaders, God abandons His people
Leadership is unnecessary in spiritual life
One should rely only on human leaders, not God
questions.correctAnswer: There may be times without earthly leaders, but God’s love and plan remain
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 mentions Israel abiding many days without a king, prince, or religious symbols, but this does not mean God’s care ceases, reminding believers to trust God even in uncertain leadership seasons.

questions.question: How does Hosea 3:5 encourage believers to persevere in faith despite spiritual dryness?
options: It promises a future return to God and reverence in latter days
It warns that spiritual failure is permanent
It suggests giving up when faith is weak
It says God will forget His people
questions.correctAnswer: It promises a future return to God and reverence in latter days
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 shows hope that Israel will return to seek the Lord and David their king, encouraging believers to persevere through trials with the assurance of God’s eventual restoration.

questions.question: According to Hosea 3:1, how should we respond to those who have turned away but still need love and grace?
options: With love reflecting God’s patient and redeeming heart
By ignoring their need for restoration
questions.correctAnswer: With love reflecting God’s patient and redeeming heart
questions.explanation: God commands Hosea to love a woman who is an adulteress, symbolizing how we should show love and grace to those who have turned from God, reflecting His compassionate heart (Hosea 3:1).

questions.question: What lesson about integrity and commitment in relationships can be drawn from Hosea 3:3?
options: Commitment means staying faithful even after failure
Commitment can be broken without consequences
Integrity is optional in difficult times
questions.correctAnswer: Commitment means staying faithful even after failure
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:3 shows Hosea’s command that the woman remain faithful despite her past, teaching believers to maintain integrity and commitment in relationships even after mistakes.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged by feeling spiritually distant from God. Based on Hosea 3:5, what biblical hope can you share?
options: God’s people will return and seek Him, experiencing His goodness
Spiritual distance is permanent and unchangeable
questions.correctAnswer: God’s people will return and seek Him, experiencing His goodness
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 promises a future return to God and reverence of His goodness, encouraging believers that restoration and renewal are possible despite current distance.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 3:4 indicates that Israel will always have a king, prince, and proper religious practices.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 states that Israel shall abide many days without a king, prince, sacrifice, image, ephod, or teraphim, indicating a period without these, not permanence.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea 3 teaches that God’s love is conditional on people’s perfect obedience from the start.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hosea 3 shows God’s love toward an adulterous woman representing Israel, indicating God’s love is patient and redeeming despite disobedience (Hosea 3:1-3).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hosea bought the woman for ______ pieces of silver and barley to demonstrate redemption.
questions.correctAnswer: fifteen
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:2 states he bought her for fifteen pieces of silver, symbolizing the cost and value of redemption.

questions.question: What practical lesson about humility and contentment can be drawn from Israel’s time without a king or sacrifices in Hosea 3:4?
options: Trusting God alone without relying on outward symbols
Demanding immediate restoration of all comforts
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting God alone without relying on outward symbols
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 describes a time without traditional leadership and religious symbols, teaching believers to humbly trust God beyond external forms.

questions.question: How does Hosea 3 exemplify God’s call to serve others through loving the unlovely?
options: By commanding Hosea to love an adulterous woman despite her failings
By instructing to love only those who deserve it
By encouraging avoidance of difficult relationships
questions.correctAnswer: By commanding Hosea to love an adulterous woman despite her failings
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1-3 shows God’s call to love someone unfaithful, teaching believers to serve others through love and mercy regardless of their past.

questions.question: What does Hosea 3:5 reveal about God’s ultimate plan for His people’s spiritual growth?
options: They will return to God, seek Him, and fear His goodness
They will remain in rebellion indefinitely
They will be abandoned without hope
They will rely only on human leaders for salvation
questions.correctAnswer: They will return to God, seek Him, and fear His goodness
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 promises a future turning back to God and reverence for Him, showing God’s desire for spiritual renewal and growth among His people.

questions.question: How can Hosea 3 encourage a believer struggling with temptation to persevere?
options: By showing God’s patient love and the call to remain faithful
By suggesting giving up when tempted
By relying only on human strength
questions.correctAnswer: By showing God’s patient love and the call to remain faithful
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1-3 illustrates God’s enduring love and Hosea’s call for faithfulness, encouraging believers to persevere through temptation relying on God’s grace.

hard.title: Hosea Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Hosea Chapter 3.

questions.question: In Hosea 3:1, the LORD commands Hosea to love a woman who is described as what?
options: Beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress
questions.correctAnswer: Beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1 states that the LORD told Hosea to love a woman who is beloved by her friend but is an adulteress, symbolizing Israel's unfaithfulness.

questions.question: According to Hosea 3:2, what did Hosea give to redeem the woman?
options: Fifteen pieces of silver and an homer and a half of barley
A bag of coins and a vineyard
questions.correctAnswer: Fifteen pieces of silver and an homer and a half of barley
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:2 describes Hosea buying the woman for fifteen pieces of silver and an homer and a half of barley, showing a redemption price.

questions.question: What does Hosea command the woman not to do during the many days she must abide with him, as stated in Hosea 3:3?
options: Not play the harlot and not be for another man
questions.correctAnswer: Not play the harlot and not be for another man
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:3 says the woman shall abide many days and not play the harlot or be for another man, symbolizing Israel’s call to faithfulness.

questions.question: Hosea 3:4 lists several things the children of Israel will be without. Which of the following is NOT mentioned as something they will be without?
questions.correctAnswer: A prophet
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 mentions Israel will be without a king, prince, sacrifice, image, ephod, and teraphim; a prophet is not listed.

questions.question: The reference to 'David their king' in Hosea 3:5 foreshadows what messianic hope found elsewhere in Scripture?
options: The coming of the Messiah from David's line
questions.correctAnswer: The coming of the Messiah from David's line
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5’s mention of David their king alludes to the messianic expectation fulfilled in Jesus, a descendant of David, as seen in the New Testament.

questions.question: The phrase 'love a woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress' in Hosea 3:1 is an example of which literary device?
questions.correctAnswer: Paradox
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1 presents a paradox by describing the woman as beloved yet adulterous, illustrating Israel's complex relationship with God.

questions.question: The 'homer' mentioned in Hosea 3:2 is best understood as what?
options: A unit of dry measure for grain
questions.correctAnswer: A unit of dry measure for grain
questions.explanation: The term 'homer' in Hosea 3:2 refers to an ancient Near Eastern measurement roughly equal to about 10 bushels, indicating the grain given for redemption.

questions.question: Hosea 3:4 lists 'without an ephod' and 'without teraphim.' What do these two items represent in the ancient Israelite religious context?
options: Objects used in divination or idolatry
Items used in the temple sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Objects used in divination or idolatry
questions.explanation: Both the ephod and teraphim mentioned in Hosea 3:4 were associated with idolatrous practices or divination, which Israel was warned against.

questions.question: Hosea 3:5 speaks of Israel returning and seeking the LORD 'in the latter days.' This phrase is often associated with what theological concept?
questions.correctAnswer: Eschatological restoration and hope
questions.explanation: 'Latter days' in Hosea 3:5 is a common biblical phrase pointing to future restoration and divine blessing, connecting to eschatological themes.

questions.question: The act of Hosea buying the woman for silver and barley in Hosea 3:2 is an example of what typological theme?
questions.correctAnswer: Redemption and covenant love
questions.explanation: Hosea’s purchase of the woman symbolizes God's redeeming love for Israel despite her unfaithfulness, reflecting covenantal restoration.

questions.question: According to the cultural context of Hosea 3, what does the metaphor of an adulterous wife primarily illustrate?
options: Israel's unfaithfulness to God through idolatry
The faithfulness of a neighboring nation
questions.correctAnswer: Israel's unfaithfulness to God through idolatry
questions.explanation: The adulterous wife metaphor in Hosea 3:1 symbolizes Israel's spiritual unfaithfulness by worshipping other gods, a common prophetic theme.

questions.question: Hosea 3:4 mentions Israel will be without 'a king, and without a prince.' Historically, this correlates with which period in Israel's history?
questions.correctAnswer: The Babylonian exile
questions.explanation: The absence of king and prince in Hosea 3:4 reflects the time of exile when Israel had no monarchic leadership, notably during Babylonian captivity.

questions.question: True or False: Hosea's command in Hosea 3:3 that the woman not play the harlot is a direct call for Israel to cease idolatry and be faithful to God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:3 uses the wife’s faithfulness as a metaphor for Israel’s required loyalty to God, symbolizing cessation of idolatry.

questions.question: Which Old Testament figure is referenced in Hosea 3:5 as 'their king,' linking Israel's future hope to a royal lineage?
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 explicitly mentions 'David their king,' connecting Israel’s restoration to the Davidic covenant.

questions.question: The 'flagon of wine' mentioned in Hosea 3:1 symbolizes what in the context of Israel’s behavior?
questions.correctAnswer: Idolatry and indulgence
questions.explanation: In Hosea 3:1, 'love flagons of wine' metaphorically refers to Israel’s indulgence in idolatrous pleasures.

theological.title: Hosea Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Hosea Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: In Hosea 3:1, God's command to Hosea to love a woman described as an adulteress symbolizes what aspect of God's relationship with Israel?
options: God’s enduring love despite Israel’s unfaithfulness
God’s judgment and rejection of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: God’s enduring love despite Israel’s unfaithfulness
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1 depicts God instructing Hosea to love a woman who is an adulteress, symbolizing God's steadfast love for Israel despite their idolatry. This theme of enduring love amid unfaithfulness is echoed in Jeremiah 31:3, Lamentations 3:22-23, Romans 5:8, and 2 Timothy 2:13.

questions.question: According to Hosea 3:2, what was the price Hosea paid to redeem the woman?
options: Fifteen pieces of silver and an homer and a half of barley
Twenty pieces of silver and two homers of wheat
Ten pieces of gold and an ephah of barley
Thirty pieces of silver and a lamb
questions.correctAnswer: Fifteen pieces of silver and an homer and a half of barley
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:2 explicitly states that Hosea bought the woman for fifteen pieces of silver, an homer of barley, and a half homer of barley, which symbolizes the cost of redemption. This redemption price parallels the concept of Christ’s atoning work (Exodus 21:32; Zechariah 11:12; Matthew 26:15; 1 Peter 1:18-19).

questions.question: What does Hosea command the woman to do in Hosea 3:3?
options: Abide many days without playing the harlot or belonging to another man
questions.correctAnswer: Abide many days without playing the harlot or belonging to another man
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:3 commands the woman to remain faithful to Hosea and not be with another man, symbolizing Israel’s call to repentance and covenant faithfulness. This mirrors the call to holiness in Leviticus 20:7, Ezekiel 16:8, 1 Corinthians 6:18-20, and Hebrews 13:4.

questions.question: Hosea 3:4 states that the children of Israel will abide many days without several things. Which of the following is NOT one of those things?
questions.correctAnswer: Temple
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 lists king, prince, sacrifice, image, ephod, and teraphim as things absent during Israel’s exile but does not mention the temple. This absence illustrates judgment and is echoed in 2 Kings 17:18, Jeremiah 7:12, Ezekiel 8:6, and Amos 8:11.

questions.question: What future hope does Hosea 3:5 provide for Israel?
options: Israel will return, seek the LORD, and David their king in the latter days
Israel will worship foreign gods openly
Israel will build a new temple on Mount Sinai
questions.correctAnswer: Israel will return, seek the LORD, and David their king in the latter days
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 promises Israel’s restoration and seeking of God and David their king, a Messianic foreshadowing fulfilled in Jesus Christ (Jeremiah 23:5, Ezekiel 34:23-24, Isaiah 11:1-10, Acts 15:14-17). This eschatological hope underscores God’s faithfulness to His covenant.

questions.question: How does Hosea’s love for the adulterous woman in Hosea 3:1-3 illustrate the nature of divine love?
options: Unconditional, redemptive love that seeks restoration
questions.correctAnswer: Unconditional, redemptive love that seeks restoration
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1-3 portrays God’s love as unconditional and redemptive, pursuing restoration despite unfaithfulness. This aligns with biblical teaching on God’s mercy and grace (Psalm 86:15, Romans 8:38-39, Ephesians 2:4-5, 1 John 4:9-10).

questions.question: What theological theme is emphasized by the absence of king, prince, sacrifice, image, ephod, and teraphim in Hosea 3:4?
options: God’s judgment through removal of political and religious structures
The establishment of a new temple system
questions.correctAnswer: God’s judgment through removal of political and religious structures
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 highlights the removal of Israel’s leadership and religious systems as a form of divine judgment, emphasizing the consequences of covenant unfaithfulness. This theme is consistent with Deuteronomy 28:36-37, 2 Chronicles 36:15-16, Jeremiah 25:9, and Ezekiel 9:6.

questions.question: The 'David their king' mentioned in Hosea 3:5 is best understood as a reference to:
options: The coming Messiah who will reign over Israel
A foreign king appointed by God
questions.correctAnswer: The coming Messiah who will reign over Israel
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5’s reference to 'David their king' points to the Messianic hope of a future ruler from David’s line, fulfilled in Jesus Christ (Isaiah 9:6-7, Jeremiah 23:5, Luke 1:32-33, Revelation 22:16).

questions.question: What does the command in Hosea 3:3 that the woman 'shall not play the harlot' symbolize in terms of Israel’s spiritual condition?
options: Faithfulness to God and covenant loyalty
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness to God and covenant loyalty
questions.explanation: The prohibition against playing the harlot in Hosea 3:3 symbolizes Israel’s call to covenant faithfulness and exclusive devotion to God, paralleling themes in Ezekiel 16:30, Jeremiah 3:1, James 4:4, and Revelation 2:20.

questions.question: In Hosea 3:2, the inclusion of barley as part of the redemption price may symbolize:
options: The low economic value and humility of the redemption
The royal status of the redeemed
questions.correctAnswer: The low economic value and humility of the redemption
questions.explanation: Barley was considered a common grain, and its inclusion with silver in Hosea 3:2 suggests the humility and low cost of redemption, emphasizing God’s grace rather than human merit. Scripture in Ruth 2:17, Leviticus 2:14, Nehemiah 5:11, and John 6:9 support this understanding.

questions.question: Which of the following best captures the eschatological dimension in Hosea 3:5?
options: Israel’s future restoration and fear of the LORD in the latter days
questions.correctAnswer: Israel’s future restoration and fear of the LORD in the latter days
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 prophesies Israel's return and reverence for God in the latter days, reflecting eschatological hope seen in Isaiah 2:2-4, Daniel 12:1-3, Zechariah 14:9, and Revelation 21:3-4.

questions.question: The phrase 'love a woman beloved of her friend, yet an adulteress' in Hosea 3:1 teaches what about God’s attitude toward sinners?
options: God loves sinners and desires their repentance and restoration
God is indifferent to human sin
questions.correctAnswer: God loves sinners and desires their repentance and restoration
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:1 illustrates God's patient and redeeming love for sinners, inviting repentance and restoration, consistent with Luke 15:11-32, Isaiah 1:18, John 3:16-17, and 2 Peter 3:9.

questions.question: What theological significance does Hosea's purchase of the woman in Hosea 3:2 hold?
options: It represents God’s redeeming work through a costly sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: It represents God’s redeeming work through a costly sacrifice
questions.explanation: The purchase in Hosea 3:2 symbolizes God’s redemption of Israel at a cost, prefiguring Christ’s sacrificial atonement (Isaiah 53:5, Mark 10:45, 1 Corinthians 6:20, Titus 2:14).

questions.question: Which of the following items mentioned in Hosea 3:4 were associated with idolatrous worship practices?
questions.correctAnswer: Image, ephod, and teraphim
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:4 lists image, ephod, and teraphim as objects linked to idolatry and false worship, indicating the spiritual corruption of Israel, consistent with Exodus 32:4, 1 Samuel 15:23, Judges 17:5, and 1 Chronicles 10:13.

questions.question: How does Hosea 3:5 reflect the attribute of God’s faithfulness?
options: God promises Israel will return and seek Him, fulfilling His covenant promises
God acts arbitrarily towards His people
questions.correctAnswer: God promises Israel will return and seek Him, fulfilling His covenant promises
questions.explanation: Hosea 3:5 demonstrates God's faithfulness as He assures Israel’s future restoration and covenant renewal, echoing Deuteronomy 7:9, Lamentations 3:22-23, 1 Corinthians 1:9, and Hebrews 10:23.
